description: Late Middle English, from  Old French barater.

entries.meaning: An exchange of goods or services without the use of money.
examples: We had no money so we had to live by barter.

entries.meaning: The goods or services used in such an exchange.
examples: The man used his watch as barter to pay for his tab.

verbs.description: barter (third-person singular simple present barters, present participle bartering, simple past and past participle bartered)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To exchange goods or services without involving money.
examples: She bartered a bonsai for one of the rare books in my library.
You may be able to barter for some of the items you need at the local market.
